dcterms:creator: D. F. Goodman
B. R.
dcterms:description: The Brian simulator is a software tool for simulating spiking neural networks, allowing researchers to model and analyze the dynamics of neural systems.
dcterms:title: BRIAN

dcterms:creator: Linssen
Charl et al.
dcterms:description: NEST is a simulator for spiking neural network models, designed to support large-scale simulations of brain-like networks.
dcterms:title: NEST

dcterms:creator: N. Carnevale
H. M.
dcterms:description: The NEURON Book provides a comprehensive guide to the NEURON simulation environment, which is used for modeling individual neurons and networks of neurons.
dcterms:title: NEURON

dcterms:creator: K. Cheung
S. S. R.
L. W.
dcterms:description: NeuroFlow is a general-purpose spiking neural network simulation platform that utilizes customizable processors for efficient computation.
dcterms:title: NeuroFlow

dcterms:creator: Painkras et al.
dcterms:description: SpiNNaker is a hardware platform designed for massively-parallel neural network simulation, featuring a 1-watt, 18-core system-on-chip architecture.
dcterms:title: SpiNNaker

dcterms:creator: Schemmel et al.
dcterms:description: BrainScaleS is a wafer-scale neuromorphic system designed for simulating large-scale spiking neural networks.
dcterms:title: BrainScaleS

dcterms:creator: Schoenauer et al.
dcterms:description: Neuropipe-chip is a digital neuro-processor specifically designed for spiking neural networks, enabling efficient computation.
dcterms:title: Neuropipe-chip

dcterms:creator: A. Rosado-Muñoz
M. Bataller-Mompeán
J. Guerrero-Martínez
dcterms:description: This dataset includes implementations of spiking neural networks on FPGA, showcasing their performance and efficiency.
dcterms:title: Spiking Neural Networks

dcterms:creator: A. Rosado-Muñoz
A. F. kowski
M. Bataller-Mompeán
J. Guerrero-Martínez
dcterms:description: This dataset presents FPGA implementations of spiking neural networks supported by a software design environment.
dcterms:title: Spiking Neural Networks supported by a Software Design Environment

dcterms:creator: Hofstoetter et al.
dcterms:description: The cerebellum chip is an analog VLSI implementation of a cerebellar model designed for classical conditioning tasks.
dcterms:title: Cerebellum chip

dcterms:creator: T. Iakymchuk
A. Rosado-Muñoz
J. F. Guerrero-Martínez
M. Bataller-Mompeán
J. V. Francés-Víllora
dcterms:description: This dataset describes a simplified spiking neural network architecture and a STDP learning algorithm applied to image classification.
dcterms:title: Simplified spiking neural network architecture

dcterms:creator: G-Q. Bi
P. M-M.
dcterms:description: This dataset explores synaptic modifications in cultured hippocampal neurons, focusing on the dependence on spike timing and synaptic strength.
dcterms:title: Synaptic modifications in cultured hippocampal neurons
